definition: Zi Lu (542-480 BC), disciple of Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3], also known as Ji Lu 季路[Ji4 Lu4]
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
surname Lu

sentences.english: Zilu and others surprised, they looked toward Confucius.
sentences.chinese: 孔丘與子路等人看，宥坐垂直。

sentences.english: From that perspective Zhong Gong's age, should be similar Zilu.
sentences.chinese: 由此看仲弓的年齡，應該與子路相近。

sentences.english: The cart rattled along the stony road.
sentences.chinese: 大車沿着石子路嘎吱嘎吱地前進。

sentences.english: Confucius' disciple Zilu, for example, was truly a brave man.
sentences.chinese: 像孔子的學生子路，就是個真正的勇者。

sentences.english: The old car rattled over the stony road.
sentences.chinese: 石子路磨損鞋底相當厲害。

sentences.english: I signed in and crunched across the gravel to my room.
sentences.chinese: 我簽到後嘎吱嘎吱走過石子路來到我的房間。

sentences.english: In other words, Zhong Gong "as Jishi slaughter" should be earlier than the Zilu.
sentences.chinese: 也就是說，仲弓“爲季氏宰”應該早於子路。

sentences.english: Entered the yard is a gravel road through the door.
sentences.chinese: 一進院子，是條直通房門的石子路。

sentences.english: Confucius, Zilu and others watch and the stool becomes upright.
sentences.chinese: 孔丘與子路等人看，宥坐垂直。

sentences.english: The car made its way down a narrow, gravel road to the grave.
sentences.chinese: 車沿着一條狹窄的石子路緩緩駛向墳墓。

sentences.english: One day the master go out, to prepare zi lu rain gear.
sentences.chinese: 一天孔子出門，讓子路準備雨具。

sentences.english: But he was very poor when he was young, living on coarse6 foods year in year out.
sentences.chinese: 但子路小的時候家裏很窮，長年靠喫粗糧野菜度日。

sentences.english: These stony roads are rather rough on the soles of your shoes.
sentences.chinese: 這種石子路磨損鞋底相當厲害。

sentences.english: Hearing that answer, Zilu was inspired to concentrate on his studies, and he eventually became a very capable individual.
sentences.chinese: 子路聽了，從此才專心向學，終於成爲有用的人才。

definition: Zi Gong or Duanmu Ci 端木賜|端木赐[Duan1 mu4 Ci4] (520 BC-), disciple of Confucius
Yan Yuan (521-481 BC), disciple of Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3], also known as 顏回|颜回[Yan2 Hui2]
Yan Hui (521-481 BC), disciple of Confucius, also known as Yan Yuan 顏淵|颜渊[Yan2 Yuan1]
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
Zengzi (505-435 BC), student of Confucius, presumed editor or author of Confucian classic the Great Learning 大學|大学[Da4 xue2]
Confucius
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
Yanzi (-c 500 BC), famous statesman from Qi of the Warring States, also known as 晏子, hero of book 晏子春秋
Zai Yu (522-458 BC), disciple of Confucius
Master/(old form of address for teachers, scholars)/pedant
Mencius 孟子 (c. 372-c. 289), Confucian philosopher
Yanzi (-c 500 BC), famous statesman from Qi of the Warring States, also known as 晏婴, hero of book 晏子春秋
Guan Zhong (-645 BC), famous politician of Qi 齊國|齐国 of Spring and Autumn period/known as Guangzi 管子
a restricted view through a bamboo tube
Xun Zi or Hsun Tzu (c. 310-237 BC), Confucian philosopher and author of On learning 勸學|劝学
Duanmu Ci (520 BC-446 BC), disciple of Confucius, also known as Zi Gong 子貢|子贡[Zi3 Gong4]
Zi Chan (?-522 BC), statesman and philosopher during the Spring and Autumn period
